Posts.Content: gail_p-m wrote: I hope this is in the right forum.  Had a mammogram in January.  Got a call-back for another mammogram and ultrasound.  Received a message from a nurse on my cell phone that the 2 spots were cysts and I should come back in 6 months for another mammogram and US.   I am 58 and post menopause for 4 years.  Before menopause, I had some cysts and call backs.  But after the ultrasounds, I was never asked to come back in 6 months.  I thought I'd ask the experts on this as to "Would you be very concerned"?       Also need to add that in Dec. I started having mild hot flashes again.   They had disappeared for at least 2 years or more prior to this.  Have also been having chills which I never ever had.  My doctor called this temperature disregulation and said I could try a course of HRT for this but I declined.  (Seemed to start right after a Dec. flu).  HMMM!  Last question.  I've been on Trazodone - 50mg for major insomnia since 2004.  Just looked at some Trazodone info. and studies showed it could contribute to breast tumors (in rodents).  Apparently, 33% of human breast tumors are "prolactin dependent" and these are the ones that could potentially be adversely effected by Trazodone.  Just wonder if anyone has been told by their doctors not to take Trazodone due to this concern.  Thank you to all of you wonderful ladies for reading this.  Prayers and thoughts are with you all.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 6 month call back/also trazodone question gail_p-m Kadia

Posts.Content: gail_p-m wrote: I have to admit that I'm one who stresses out easily and now I have something to really stress about.  I'm 58 years old and newly retired.  As a matter of fact, I'm supposed to leave on a celebration cruise on Jan. 28th.  Went for my mammogram which I do every 2 years and I've been called back.  On Friday, I will have another mammogram and an ultrasound.  I thought I'd know what's what by then.  However, after reading your posts, it looks like they could want to do a needle biopsy then.  And then if they don't get the results, they might want to do an operation.  Am I correct?  I should also add that I haven't been feeling all that well for a month now.  Have been tired, had a lot of chills and have been losing some weight.  Not sure what I'm looking for here but I just had to "talk" to someone. Thanks for listening to me.  I need someone to care.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: so scared gail_p-m gail_p-m

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2012 07:24PM gail_p-m wrote: Just want to say that I appreciate the replies that I have gotten and the ones I will receive.  It makes me feel not so alone.  I will post as this progresses.    (((Just want to say that I love message boards -- belonged to one when my father had lung cancer and it was so, so helpful)).  Hugs to all of you. ---  Gail
Posts.Title: so scared gail_p-m gail_p-m

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 05:04PM gail_p-m wrote: Thanks to all who responded and made me feel like I wasn't alone.  Even my husband has been away during most of this time.  When I went in today, I found out both were cysts (probably, I guess).  I have to go back in 6 months to have another ultrasound and mammogram.  Does this make sense?  I assume if they were still concerned, more follow-up would have been suggested?    I am really exhausted today.  Haven't slept well this week.  Even had a dream last night that I saw things hanging off my boob (exterior, that is)!!!!  I had the mammo/ultrasound and was done by 10 AM.  I had to hang around till 3 to get my results today; otherwise, they were going to call me on Tuesday.  I don't think I would've lasted.  If they had found something today, I was going to get a copy and start researching as Knowledge is Power.  But I prefer not to be researching this weekend, for sure.  I know I'm rambling but have to say what a wonderful message board this is.  You ladies have been wonderful to me.  I wish I could do more for you than just send my prayers.  This cancer journey is certainly frightening and you people are so positive and supportive of one another.   Any thoughts on how I can help BC?  It is so prevalent.   I am going to be checking on you regularly  Hugs to all of you --  Gail
Posts.Title: so scared gail_p-m gail_p-m

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 06:51AM gail_p-m wrote: Thank you for all the caring I've received from you.  Tomorrow I go in for futher testing and hope I get some answers but I may not.  I'm truly amazed by all your kindness and I am not even diagnosed yet and you all have your own "issues" that you are dealing with.  I will let you know what happens tomorrow.  What a wonderful message board.  My thoughts and prayers for each and every one of you.  Gail
Posts.Title: so scared gail_p-m gail_p-m

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 10:29AM gail_p-m wrote: Oh, I really hear you now!  These everyday "things" of life become so irrelevant, don't they.  We're pretending to be there (at the meeting) and throw in our comments but we're not really there at all.  Yes, the BC thing is constantly on my mind too.  (I actually just retired in June so I'm thankful I'm not juggling work with this too right now).  I usually go in to babysit my 18 mo. old grandson on Thurs. and Fri. -- I stay overnight - but because of the Fri. appt, my husband has gone in to do it.  (This should be intersting in itself).   I'm almost happy not to have my hubby around because I just don't even feel like making "small talk" when I'm so preoccupied.  I have my 2 dogs with me right now and that's all I need.  If you get a good outcome, is there anyway you could skip the business trip or shorten it to take time for yourself to breathe and rest?   Prayers for good news for both of us!   Gail
Posts.Title: Biopsy Tomorrow invirginia hopeful123

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 09:45AM gail_p-m wrote: Hi inVirginia --  I'm 58 and also having follow-ups tomorrow too, though I don't quite know what abnormality that was found yet.  Unlike you, I have not come to grips with "if they find something" so I congratulate you on that one.  I just don't sleep or eat right now. But why I am writing is to say "don't worry about that business trip".  You are the priority right now.  If you do have BC, they will totally understand and will deal with that business trip -- somehow.  You need to be the priority.  And I do know from my job that there have been times where I've wondered if I will be there for certain things (due to other different scares) and how weird it is to go on as if nothing is  happening, but we have to do that. But please, put your concern on yourself.  You don't need the other stress about not telling them that you might have cancer.  Hopefully, you don't have to deal with that but if you do, deal with it when the time comes.  They will understand.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Tomorrow invirginia hopeful123

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2012 07:01PM gail_p-m wrote: Sorry, I've tried and tried and can't figure out how to edit my post!!!  Just wanted to add that I went back to hospital this afternoon and picked up the FNA Pathology report.  "One of the smears is moderately cellular containing stromal fragments as well as multiple predominantly small and choesive aggregates of ductal epithelial cells.  These do show a mild degree of cytological atypica with modest nuclear pleomorphism and occasional prominent nucleoli but with dispersed chromatin and no obvious mitotic activity.  They have also scheduled me for an ultrasound of the breast on May 3rd.  Would still appreciate anyone's thoughts on this pathology report.  I've been researching but don't understand most of it.  Thanks.
Posts.Title: atypical cells found next to complex cyst AlwaysAnxious marie5890

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 11:43AM gail_p-m wrote: As another 58 year old with cystic breasts, I do understand what you're going through.  The waiting is terrible.  Hoping you get good results in a very timely manner.  The waiting is so, so difficult.
